Text: Lord Howe Island ( ; formerly Lord Howe's Island) is an irregularly crescent-shaped volcanic remnant in the Tasman Sea between Australia and New Zealand, directly east of mainland Port Macquarie, and about southwest of Norfolk Island.

Text: Lord Howe Island:  Most of the population lives in the north, while the south is dominated by forested hills rising to the highest point on the island, Mount Gower (875 m ).
